elements.content: The hydrothermal reaction of CuCl2·2H2O, H4edta, and H2O yields [Cu(H2edta)] n complex in which the Cu atom is surrounded by two nitrogen donors and three oxygen donors of the H2edta2- ligand and the sixth coordinated site is coordinated by the oxygen atom of the nonprotonated acetate group in the neighboring complex to form a polymeric helical chain structure.
elements.clean_text: The hydrothermal reaction of CuCl2⋅2H2O, H4edta, and H2O yields [Cu(H2edta)] n  complex in which the Cu atom is surrounded by two nitrogen donors and three oxygen donors of the H2edta2- ligand and the sixth coordinated site is coordinated by the oxygen atom of the nonprotonated acetate group in the neighboring complex to form a polymeric helical chain structure.

elements.content: The coordination chemistry of ethylenediamine-N,N,N‘,N‘-tetraacetic acid (H4edta) with first-row transition metal ions has been widely studied and structurally well characterized. The mono- and diprotonated ethylenediamine-N,N,N‘,N‘-tetraacetate (Hedta3- and H2edta2-) can act either as a pentadentate ligand to form a six-coordinate octahedron or as a hexadentate ligand to form a seven-coordinate distorted monocapped trigonal prism or pentagonal bipyramid, often with a water molecule as a sixth or seventh ligand, respectively. Some examples are six coordination of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Cr, Fe, Co), {[NiII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [MII(H2edta)(H2O)] (M = Ni, Cu), and seven coordination of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Ti, V), {[MnII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [CoII(H2edta)(H2O)]. Other related structures containing hexadentate edta4- are [FeII(edta)(H2O)]·2NaClO4·6H2O, Na[TiIII(edta)(H2O)]·2H2O, [TiIV(edta)(H2O)], K[TiIII(edta)(H2O)]·2.5H2O, and NH4[CoIIIedta]·2H2O. However, no six-coordinate [M(Hedta)] and [M(H2edta)] type complexes are known in which these ligands act as a hexadentate ligand. In this work, we examine the hydrothermal synthesis of the first [MII(H2edta)] type complex with the H2edta2- bridging ligand coordinating to the copper(II) ions. The synthesis, X-ray single-crystal structure, and magnetic property of [Cu(edtaH2)] n complex are reported herein.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

The coordination chemistry of ethylenediamine-N,N,N‘,N‘-tetraacetic acid (H4edta) with first-row transition metal ions has been widely studied and structurally well characterized. The mono- and diprotonated ethylenediamine-N,N,N‘,N‘-tetraacetate (Hedta3- and H2edta2-) can act either as a pentadentate ligand to form a six-coordinate octahedron or as a hexadentate ligand to form a seven-coordinate distorted monocapped trigonal prism or pentagonal bipyramid, often with a water molecule as a sixth or seventh ligand, respectively. Some examples are six coordination of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Cr, Fe, Co), {[NiII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [MII(H2edta)(H2O)] (M = Ni, Cu), and seven coordination of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Ti, V), {[MnII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [CoII(H2edta)(H2O)]. Other related structures containing hexadentate edta4- are [FeII(edta)(H2O)]⋅2NaClO4⋅6H2O, Na[TiIII(edta)(H2O)]⋅2H2O, [TiIV(edta)(H2O)], K[TiIII(edta)(H2O)]⋅2.5H2O, and NH4[CoIIIedta]⋅2H2O. However, no six-coordinate [M(Hedta)] and [M(H2edta)] type complexes are known in which these ligands act as a hexadentate ligand. In this work, we examine the hydrothermal synthesis of the first [MII(H2edta)] type complex with the H2edta2- bridging ligand coordinating to the copper(II) ions. The synthesis, X-ray single-crystal structure, and magnetic property of [Cu(edtaH2)] n  complex are reported herein.

elements.content: Materials and Physical Techniques. All chemicals were of reagent grade and were used as commercially obtained without further purification. The infrared spectrum was recorded on a Nicolet Fourier transform IR, MAGNA-IR 500 spectrometer in the range 500−4000 cm-1 using the KBr disk technique. Magnetic measurement was carried out on polycrystalline samples with a SQUID magnetometer. Molar magnetic susceptibility was recorded every 5 K in the range 5−300 K with 10 000 G external field.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Materials and Physical Techniques. All chemicals were of reagent grade and were used as commercially obtained without further purification. The infrared spectrum was recorded on a Nicolet Fourier transform IR, MAGNA-IR 500 spectrometer in the range 500-4000 cm-1 using the KBr disk technique. Magnetic measurement was carried out on polycrystalline samples with a SQUID magnetometer. Molar magnetic susceptibility was recorded every 5 K in the range 5-300 K with 10000 G external field.

elements.content: Preparation of [Cu(EDTAH 2 )] n . A mixture of CuCl2·2H2O (0.341 g, 2 mmol), H4edta (0.2292 g, 1 mmol), 5% HNO3 (2 drops), and H2O (5 mL) was put into a 23 mL poly(tetrafluoroethylene)-lined stainless steel autoclave container and heated for 24 h at 80 °C under auto generous pressure. After the mixture was cooled to room temperature, violet crystals were collected in 44% yield along with unreacted H4edta. IR (KBr) ν/cm-1:  1734 (s), 1605 (vs), 1564 (s), 1388 (s), 1313, 1207, 1174, 1122 (m), 1010, 977, 934, 892, 861, 751, 699, 641, 587 (w). Anal. Calcd:  C, 33.95; H, 3.99; N, 7.92. Found:  C, 33.68; H, 3.35; N, 7.85.
elements.clean_text: Preparation of [Cu(EDTAH  2  )]  n  . A mixture of CuCl2⋅2H2O (0.341 g, 2 mmol), H4edta (0.2292 g, 1 mmol), 5% HNO3 (2 drops), and H2O (5 mL) was put into a 23 mL poly(tetrafluoroethylene)-lined stainless steel autoclave container and heated for 24 h at 80 °C under auto generous pressure. After the mixture was cooled to room temperature, violet crystals were collected in 44% yield along with unreacted H4edta. IR (KBr) ν/cm-1: 1734 (s), 1605 (vs), 1564 (s), 1388 (s), 1313, 1207, 1174, 1122 (m), 1010, 977, 934, 892, 861, 751, 699, 641, 587 (w). Anal. Calcd: C, 33.95; H, 3.99; N, 7.92. Found: C, 33.68; H, 3.35; N, 7.85.

elements.content: X-ray Crystallography. A violet crystal of approximately 0.20 × 0.15 × 0.10 mm3 was mounted on a glass capillary. Data collection was carried out on a Bruker SMART CCD diffractometer with Mo radiation at room temperature. A preliminary orientation matrix and unit cell parameters were determined from 3 runs of 15 frames each, each frame corresponding to a 0.3° scan in 15 s, followed by spot integration and least-squares refinement. Data were measured using an ω scan of 0.3° per frame for 20 s until a complete hemisphere had been collected. Cell parameters were retrieved using SMART software and refined with SAINT on all observed reflections. Data reduction was performed with the SAINT software and corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects. Absorption corrections were applied with the program SADABS. The structures were solved by direct methods with the SHELX-93 program and refined by full-matrix least-squares methods on F 2 with SHEXLTL-PC V 5.03. All non-hydrogen atomic positions were located in difference Fourier maps and refined anisotropically. The hydrogen atoms of the acetate group were located in difference Fourier maps and refined isotropically, and other hydrogen atoms were placed in their geometrically generated positions. Detailed data collection and refinement of the complex are summarized in Table , and selected bond distances and angles are listed in Table . Other crystallographic data are given as Supporting Information.

Cell parameters were retrieved using SMART software and refined with SAINT on all observed  reflections. Data reduction was performed with the SAINT software and corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects. Absorption corrections were applied with the program SADABS. The structures were solved by direct methods with the SHELX-93 program and refined by full-matrix least-squares methods on F 2 with SHEXLTL-PC V 5.03. All non-hydrogen atomic positions were located in difference Fourier maps and refined anisotropically. The hydrogen atoms of the acetate group were located in difference Fourier maps and refined isotropically, and other hydrogen atoms were placed in their geometrically generated positions. Detailed data collection and refinement of the complex are summarized in Table , and selected bond distances and angles are listed in Table . Other crystallographic data are given as Supporting Information.

Synthesis. The [Cu(H2edta)] n compound can be obtained using only the hydrothermal method, where the acidic aqua solution of CuCl2·2H2O and H4edta were put into the stainless steel autoclave container and heated for 24 h at 80 °C under auto generous pressure. The compound was identified by infrared spectra and elemental analysis, and its structure was determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

 Synthesis. The [Cu(H2edta)] n  compound can be obtained using only the hydrothermal method, where the acidic aqua solution of CuCl2⋅2H2O and H4edta were put into the stainless steel autoclave container and heated for 24 h at 80 °C under auto generous pressure. The compound was identified by infrared spectra and elemental analysis, and its structure was determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction.

elements.content: Structural Description. Figure a shows a perspective drawing of [Cu(H2edta)] n and the labeling of the atoms. Selected bond distances and angles are given in Table . The molecular structure of [Cu(H2edta)] n is similar to the corresponding six-coordinated edta-related complexes of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Cr, Fe, Co3), {[NiII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [MII(H2edta)(H2O)] (M = Ni, Cu6), but the sixth water coordinated site is replaced by the oxygen atom of the nonprotonated acetate group in the neighboring complex to form a polymeric helical chain. A clear view is shown in Figure b. This is the first structure in which a helically polymeric chain is constructed by the bridging H2edta2- ligand. The nearest Cu···Cu distance is 5.221(2) Å which is shorter than 5.517, 5.581, and 5.578 Å of Ni···Ni, Co···Co, and Zn···Zn distances, respectively, found in the series of [MM‘(edta)(H2O)4]·2H2O complexes (M, M‘ = Ni, Co, Zn). The environment about the copper atom involves a tetragonally distorted octahedral geometry with four coplanar bonds of nearly equivalent length (Cu(1)−N(1) 2.106(2), Cu(1)−O(1) 1.943(2), Cu(1)−O(5) 1.952(2), Cu(1)−O(6) 1.985(2) Å) and two longer tetragonal bonds (Cu(1)−N(2) 2.400(2), Cu(1)−O(3) 2.459(2) Å). Comparable bond distances found in the tetragonally distorted octahedral compounds, [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)]6 and Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]·H2O, are as follows:  Cu−N 2.066(2), 2.291(2); Cu−O 1.970(2), 1.929(2), and 2.467(2); and Cu−O(water) 1.978(3) Å for [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)], and Cu−N 2.073(4), 2.344(5); Cu−O 1.933(4), 1.942(4), and 2.528(4); and Cu−O(water) 1.994(4) Å for Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]·H2O. The H2edta2- ligand acts as a hexadentate bridging ligand in which two nitrogen donors (N(1), N(2)), two oxygens of two acetate groups (O(1), O(5)), and one acetatic group O(3) coordinate to one copper(II) ion and the sixth acetate oxygen atom O(6) coordinates to the other copper(II) ion. The hydrogens for acetic acid groups were located in the difference map. These positions are supported by the C−O bond lengths in the acetate groups. The protonated C(6)−O(4) and C(10)−O(7) bond lengths of 1.318(4) and 1.326(4) Å are obviously longer than other acetate C−O bond lengths of an average value of 1.238 Å. The C(6)−O(3) distance of 1.210(4) Å with the long Cu(1)−O(3) distance (2.459(2) Å) is also shorter than the other three coordinated C−O bond distances (C(4)−O(1) 1.277(3), C(8)−O(5) 1.259(3), and C(8)−O(6) 1.257(3) Å). Other C−N (av 1.479 Å) and C−C (av 1.520 Å) bond lengths in H2edta2- ligand are normal and consistent with other M−edta related complexes, like 1.478 and 1.518 Å in [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)]6 and 1.476 and 1.516 Å in Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]·H2O.
elements.clean_text: Structural Description. Figure a shows a perspective drawing of [Cu(H2edta)] n  and the labeling of the atoms. Selected bond distances and angles are given in Table . The molecular structure of [Cu(H2edta)] n  is similar to the corresponding six-coordinated edta-related complexes of [MIII(Hedta)(H2O)] (M = Cr, Fe, Co3), {[NiII(Hedta)(H2O)]-}, and [MII(H2edta)(H2O)] (M = Ni, Cu6), but the sixth water coordinated site is replaced by the oxygen atom of the nonprotonated acetate group in the neighboring complex to form a polymeric helical chain. A clear view is shown in Figure b. This is the first structure in which a helically polymeric chain is constructed by the bridging H2edta2- ligand. The nearest Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu distance is 5.221(2) Å which is shorter than 5.517, 5.581, and 5.578 Å of Ni⋅⋅⋅Ni, Co⋅⋅⋅Co, and Zn⋅⋅⋅Zn distances, respectively, found in the series of [MM‘(edta)(H2O)4]⋅2H2O complexes (M, M‘ = Ni, Co, Zn). The environment about the copper atom involves a tetragonally distorted octahedral geometry with four coplanar bonds of nearly equivalent length (Cu(1)-N(1) 2.106(2), Cu(1)-O(1) 1.943(2), Cu(1)-O(5) 1.952(2), Cu(1)-O(6) 1.985(2) Å) and two longer tetragonal bonds (Cu(1)-N(2) 2.400(2), Cu(1)-O(3) 2.459(2) Å). Comparable bond distances found in the tetragonally distorted octahedral compounds, [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)]6 and Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]⋅H2O, are as follows: Cu-N 2.066(2), 2.291(2); Cu-O 1.970(2), 1.929(2), and 2.467(2); and Cu-O(water) 1.978(3) Å for [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)], and Cu-N 2.073(4), 2.344(5); Cu-O 1.933(4), 1.942(4), and 2.528(4);  and Cu-O(water) 1.994(4) Å for Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]⋅H2O. The H2edta2- ligand acts as a hexadentate bridging ligand in which two nitrogen donors (N(1), N(2)), two oxygens of two acetate groups (O(1), O(5)), and one acetatic group O(3) coordinate to one copper(II) ion and the sixth acetate oxygen atom O(6) coordinates to the other copper(II) ion. The hydrogens for acetic acid groups were located in the difference map. These positions are supported by the C-O bond lengths in the acetate groups. The protonated C(6)-O(4) and C(10)-O(7) bond lengths of 1.318(4) and 1.326(4) Å are obviously longer than other acetate C-O bond lengths of an average value of 1.238 Å. The C(6)-O(3) distance of 1.210(4) Å with the long Cu(1)-O(3) distance (2.459(2) Å) is also shorter than the other three coordinated C-O bond distances (C(4)-O(1) 1.277(3), C(8)-O(5) 1.259(3), and C(8)-O(6) 1.257(3) Å). Other C-N (av 1.479 Å) and C-C (av 1.520 Å) bond lengths in H2edta2- ligand are normal and consistent with other M-edta related complexes, like 1.478 and 1.518 Å in [Cu(H2edta)(H2O)]6 and 1.476 and 1.516 Å in Ag[Cu(Hedta)(H2O)]⋅H2O.

elements.content: Packing pictures viewing alonga axes of [Cu(H2edta)] n . Dash lines indicate the interchain hydrogen bonds.

elements.content: Ring Strain. The H2edta2- ligand forms four chelate rings with the Cu atom involving three glycinate and one ethylenediamine rings. The strain of the chelate rings could be measured by the sums of the angles of the five-membered chelate rings, as has been proposed by Hoard et al. The idealized angle sums are 527.9° and 538.9° for the ethylenediamine and glycinate backbone, respectively. The sums of the angles of the five-membered chelate rings for some six-coordinate M−edta complexes are given in Table . The angle sums of E ring obtained from [Cu(H2edta)] n are 513.7(2)°. This result reveals that the E ring exhibits a “strain” similar to that of other metal−edta complexes listed in Table . The sums of the R rings for chelation, 538.6(3)°, and chelation, 538.5(3)°, are not significantly different from that of 540.0° for a pentagon, but the sum of G ring for chelation, 525.1(2)°, deviates quite markedly. These sum values are also comparable with those of some six-coordinate M−edta complexes (Table ).
elements.clean_text: Ring Strain. The H2edta2- ligand forms four chelate rings with the Cu atom involving three glycinate and one ethylenediamine rings. The strain of the chelate rings could be measured by the sums of the angles of the five-membered chelate rings, as has been proposed by Hoard et al. The idealized angle sums are 527.9° and 538.9° for the ethylenediamine and glycinate backbone, respectively. The sums of the angles of the five-membered chelate rings for some six-coordinate M-edta complexes are given in Table . The angle sums of E ring    obtained from [Cu(H2edta)] n  are 513.7(2)°. This result reveals that the E ring exhibits a "strain" similar to that of other metal-edta complexes listed in Table . The sums of the R rings for    chelation, 538.6(3)°, and    chelation, 538.5(3)°, are not significantly different from that of 540.0° for a pentagon, but the sum of G ring for    chelation, 525.1(2)°, deviates quite markedly. These sum values are also comparable with those of some six-coordinate M-edta complexes (Table ).

Comparisons of Ring Bond Angle Sums (deg) for Some Six-Coordinate Metal−edta Complexes

compound E ring R ring G ring ref NH4[CoIIIedta]·2H2O 520.9 537.8 523.5 14 [CrIII(Hedta)(H2O)] 521.6 536.2, 539.5 524.3 1 [FeIII(Hedta)(H2O)] 513.7 539.7, 535.0 526.4 2 [CoIII(Hedta)(H2O)] 517.2 537.8 523.5 3 [NiII(H2edta)(H2O)] 514.5 538.4 524.9 5 [CuII(H2edta)(H2O)] 513.9 538.9, 539.5 527.0 6 [CuII(H2edta)] n 513.7 538.6, 538.5 525.1 this work

Hydrogen Bonding. There are two intermolecular hydrogen bonds existing between the [Cu(H2edta)] n polymeric chains. The protonated carboxylic group O(4)−H(4) forms an intrachain hydrogen bond with the coordinated oxygen, O(1), and the other protonated acetic group, O(7)−H(7), forms an interchain hydrogen bond with the uncoordinated oxygen, O(2). The O···O distances of intrachain O(4)···O(1) and interchain O(7)···O(2) are 2.696(3) and 2.674(4) Å, with the O(4)−H(4)···O(1) and O(7)−H(7)···O(2) angles 165.2(8)° and 168.4(8)°, respectively. The packing diagram of [Cu(H2edta)] n , illustrated in Figure , shows the interaction (dashed line) of hydrogen bonds between the [Cu(H2edta)] n chains.
elements.clean_text: Hydrogen Bonding. There are two intermolecular hydrogen bonds existing between the [Cu(H2edta)] n  polymeric chains. The protonated carboxylic group O(4)-H(4) forms an intrachain hydrogen bond with the coordinated oxygen, O(1), and the other protonated acetic group, O(7)-H(7), forms an interchain hydrogen bond with the uncoordinated oxygen, O(2). The O⋅⋅⋅O distances of intrachain O(4)⋅⋅⋅O(1) and interchain O(7)⋅⋅⋅O(2) are 2.696(3) and 2.674(4) Å, with the O(4)-H(4)⋅⋅⋅O(1) and O(7)-H(7)⋅⋅⋅O(2) angles 165.2(8)° and 168.4(8)°, respectively. The packing diagram of [Cu(H2edta)] n , illustrated in Figure , shows the interaction (dashed line) of hydrogen bonds between the [Cu(H2edta)] n  chains.

elements.content: Magnetic Susceptibility. The experimental curves of the molar magnetic susceptibility χ M (○) and effective magnetic moment (μ eff) (□) with respect to temperature (T) for [Cu(H2edta)] n is displayed in Figure . The temperature dependence basically follows the Curie−Weiss law, and very weak antiferromagnetic interaction has been observed below 25 K.
elements.clean_text: Magnetic Susceptibility. The experimental curves of the molar magnetic susceptibility χ M (○) and effective magnetic moment (μ eff) (□) with respect to temperature (T) for [Cu(H2edta)] n  is displayed in Figure . The temperature dependence basically follows the Curie-Weiss law, and very weak antiferromagnetic interaction has been observed below 25 K.

elements.content: Magnetic data of [Cu(H2edta)] n . Legend:  ○, indicates the molar magnetic susceptibility, χ M, and □, the effective magnetic moment, μ eff.
elements.clean_text: 3  Magnetic data of [Cu(H2edta)] n . Legend: ○, indicates the molar magnetic susceptibility, χ M, and □, the effective magnetic moment, μ eff.

elements.content: In summary, we have synthesized a new Cu(II) coordination network based on the H2edta2- bridging ligand to form a helically polymeric chain. The structural characterization and ring strain of [Cu(H2edta)] n complex has been completely described and compared with other related metal−edta complexes. The magnetic property has been satisfactorily explained.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In summary, we have synthesized a new Cu(II) coordination network based on the H2edta2- bridging ligand to form a helically polymeric chain. The structural characterization and ring strain of [Cu(H2edta)] n  complex has been completely described and compared with other related metal-edta complexes. The magnetic property has been satisfactorily explained.

A mixture of CuCl2⋅2H2O (0.341 g, 2 mmol), H4edta (0.2292 g, 1 mmol), 5% HNO3 (2 drops), and H2O (5 mL) was put into a 23 mL poly(tetrafluoroethylene)-lined stainless steel autoclave container and heated for 24 h at 80 °C under auto generous pressure. After the mixture was cooled to room temperature, violet crystals were collected in 44% yield along with unreacted H4edta. IR (KBr) ν/cm-1: 1734 (s), 1605 (vs), 1564 (s), 1388 (s), 1313, 1207, 1174, 1122 (m), 1010, 977, 934, 892, 861, 751, 699, 641, 587 (w). Anal. Calcd: C, 33.95; H, 3.99; N, 7.92. Found: C, 33.68; H, 3.35; N, 7.85.

metadata.title:
Hydrothermal Synthesis and Structural Characterization of a
Two-Dimensional Polymeric Copper(II) Complex Containing an Unusual
Bridged H2edta2- Ligand
